conbody.p: A list of global Media Folders can be set using the Media tab of the Preferences dialog. Phon will look at each of these folders (in the order in whicy they appear) for media files.

The media folders can be internally structured to match Phon's project/corpus layout. Phon will search the following locations for media (where <media> is the media folder defined in Preferences, <project> is the project name, <corpus> is the corpus name, and <session> is the session name):
<media>/<project>/<corpus>/<session>.[aif;avi;mov;mpg;mp4;wav;mp3;m4a;...]
<media>/<project>/<session>.[...]
<media>/<corpus>/<session>.[...]
<media>/<session>.[...]

If the Media field in the Session Information view of the Session Editor has been manually changed:
if the path is absolute (or fully-specified), the above rules are ignored and the media file is loaded from the specified path
if the path is relative, the value of '<session>' above is replaced by the value in the media field.
